Reviews.Title: “A+++ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BenL94
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Got off the train and with the help of Google maps quickly found it. It is down a bit of a back alley, but it is so close to Nathan Rd & is about 1 minute walk to Kimberly Rd. I checked in at 00:00 and the staff were brilliant and even gave me a free upgrade. The room was spacious for a HK hotel room and the room was amazingly nice. Great view of the Hong Kong skyline from my room! Am planning to stay here every time I come to HK! Note: I stayed in the cheapest room

Reviews.Title: “Bauhinia Hotel - Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: docbrown59
Reviews.Content: This place is a great value. The room was very tastefully done and service was meticulous. It is walking distance to most tourist and shopping sites. It is a block from Knudsford food terrance and some great food. The view from our 15th floor room was to two sides. Do not let reception being on the 19th floor put you off.

Reviews.Title: “great place, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Christina N
Reviews.Content: Great place with extremely fast internet. We got upgraded to the harbour view room which was awesome. Room is small, like all hotels in HK, but it was decent for the two of us. Room was sufficiently clean. A tad far from the MRT entrance (about 15 min walk) but its ok since there are restaurants and shops along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely modernised room - good once inside!”
Reviews.Author: turkeyfan
Reviews.Content: This was a very last minute booking when we failed to get on our ongoing flight whilst in transit in HK. I didn't have much time to research but know the Tsim Sha Tsui area and this seemed to be the best deal for the price. The taxi driver had problems finding it (as did others in the reviews) and we directed him using our map. I was a bit shocked at the location in what looked like a bit of a shabby back street up a steep, if short hill. First impressions were not good as the hotel doesn't have a proper reception, just a side doorway into a lift lobby. The lift was in the process of refurbishment and was lined with plywood and tape - rather depressing! The reception on the 9th floor was just a very small area in front of the lift and there were virtually no facilities other than a very small bar/lounge area which I couldn't have imagined spending time in. The room was pleasant if compact and the bathroom an attractive but unusual design which rather dominated the room. Definitely not for anyone who values their privacy. It looked new and was very nicely decorated. I would really put this more in the category of an apartotel rather than a hotel. The staff were pleasant at the desk but other than check in/check out there was no service or facilities to enjoy. The dual aspect views from the windows on our very high floor were great. I was envious of the large public pool complex in the park below. The free wifi was a bonus, a major irritant when it's lacking or charged for. The area seemed very strange at night. We ventured out for something to eat, by this time very late at night and had a bad experience in the local traditional chinese restaurant (didn't note the name) but they appeared not to understand English. Even though I carefully pointed out and confirmed my dish I was brought something totally different containing lots of fatty pork (I don't eat meat!) the waiter just walked off when I objected and asked for it to be changed. By this time I was too tired to bother. Incidentally this was the only bad meal I had in HK. The next day the area appeared less seedy and and turned out to be very convenient for sightseeing. The free airport bus at the bottom of the short hill was a real bonus. I wouldn't plan to stay again at this hotel, though if it was the cheapest in the category I might be swayed. It was however preferable to the BP International where we stayed the following night.

Reviews.Title: “Well-priced hotel in the centre of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: charlie_steel
Reviews.Content: Great room with excellent facilities, bathroom clean and well-equipped. Chose the hotel due to price and location, and was not disappointed. Would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Value, location, just what you need”
Reviews.Author: renegado_12
Reviews.Content: This boutique mid range hotel exceeded my expectations. Brand new, clean, chic and competitively priced. Staff were amazing, even greeting me by name in the reception area which I don't expect in this class of hotel. Yes, the hotel is up a bit of a slope, but it's no "big hill" like some other reviews stated. Drycleaner / laundry (overpriced, cheaper options nearby) opposite the hotel as well as a couple of quiet bars. Arrived early but staff were more than happy to look after my bags. Lobby is on the 7th floor. There is 24 hour security at ground level also. You need your keycard to access guest floors in the elevator. Room standard size by Hong Kong standards, spotlessly clean. Lovely soft bed, spacious bathroom, AMAZING shower, LCD tv, iPod dock (nice touch). Basic hotel, but very modern and chic, has the basics, what you need, nothing you don't. Plenty to do even in the Tsim Sha Tsui area, 10min or less walk to MTR station. Knutsford Terrace just around the corner (literally), which is a strip of terrace style restaurants. Some excellent dining. This also backs onto the Miramar shopping mall. Cheaper eating also found in a number of places on Kimberly Road also around the corner. Hope to stay again on my next visit to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: 355John
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights, starting March 9th, 2012. This is a great hotel, very clean, the room was small but had everything we needed. The bathroom and the room were spotless; checking very fast. We did not know about the free bus shuttle to the Empire Hotel (which is basically accross the street) so we took the train from the airport (70 Hong Kong dollars which was about $9 US/per person) to one of the subway stations by the hotel, then taxi (appx $5 US) from the train station to the hotel. The location was perfect, everything within walking distance; very easy access to subways and the ferry which takes you to the other part of the island. In Hong Kong, if you want grocery store with European/Western food, go to either the Elements plaza (by the Ritz Carlton) or to the Queensplaza - you can access both locations very easy by subway. The Queensplaza had an excellent restaurant (in the basement/ in the grocery shop) that served western type breakfast and lunches, very good price as well. We had a great experience and absolutely loved this hotel. We will definitely stay at this place again while in Hong Kong. Great value for your money. If you have time, go see the Gold Coast in Hong Kong - you can take a bus or subway to Tsun Mun-great resort community and we had a fabulous time at the Marina and Yacht club. Would recommend the Gold Coast Hotel while on the gold coast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtwang
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value. Rooms are somewhat small but to be expected for Hong Kong. Decor is modern, wifi is fast, and the bathroom was fabulous. My bathroom was actually about 2/3 the size of the bedroom. I think the hotel is less well known so taxi drivers don't really know where it is. It is perhaps easier to tell them the Stanford Hillview Hotel which is about 50 feet away - as you approach the Stanford the Bauhinia is on Observatory Court which is a small road to the right. As for how steep the hill is, it's really not that bad, no worse than anything you might encounter in the Haight in San Francisco or any number of neighborhoods in Seattle. I was able to easily roll a 70-lb bag up and down it.

Reviews.Title: “What more can I ask!”
Reviews.Author: sawbear1608
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights from 03 - 06 Feb. You can catch the free airport shuttle from Kowloon station and get off at Empire Hotel. From there, it's up the slope to the hotel. The reception lobby was located on 19th floor. Check in was swift and I was upgraded from superior room to deluxe room. The room was spacious enough for 2 people. It's not big, but it is comfortable and clean. No complain about the room! Just opposite the hotel building, there are a few Irish pubs and also a local Chinese cafe where you could get food (except Sunday). There's a supermarket and also a few convenience stores within reach. Initially, walking up the slope was rather challenging but we found that you could avoid the slope by walking on Knutsford Terrace. You could actually connect all the way to the Miramar shopping mall at Nathan road! This is a relatively new hotel.....definitely will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: WillWork4Travel9
Reviews.Content: We had to wait for about 15 mins to get checked in, it was no biggie really, but for our "trouble", they upgraded our room to a corner deluxe room! The room was fantastic! Very clean, spacious, modern, quiet, it was great. The location, if not for the steep slope, would have been perfect. It's within walking distance to everything. The staff was very friendly and patient as we had so many questions on how to get around. The housekeeping staff was extremely thorough. Free wired internet connection in the room, they even have computers with fast internet connection at the lobby. No restaurant in the hotel but there were plenty outside so finding a place to eat is hardly an issue. I will definitely stay here again and would have no problem recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need, nothing you don't: Location, wifi, great rooms, great views!”
Reviews.Author: Realq86
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of ballar 6-7 star hotels in HK for you to spoil yourself on, especially in the Tsim Sha Tsui area. However there are also a lot of choices for budget/valued conscious minded travels and this is one of my favorite! I travel to HK a lot and because of a friend working in the Starwood group I always stay at the W in Kowloon station. So I consider myself pretty spoiled about hotels in HK. When I no longer can get the family and friends rate at the W, I've been experimenting with boutique hotels in the Tsim Sha Tsui area. The rule of thumb I had is, hotels get cheaper and better with each city block you are willing to walk away from a MTR station or the Harbor City mall. This hotel fits the description the best! If you are someone who only need a decent place to rest at night while you roam the city by day this one of the place for you! As my title suggests, you pay for the things you need and nothing you don't! I got upgraded into a harbor view room upon arriving for free which was great! The hotel is great (4 star), roomy for HK, has free internet, and just 4 blocks from the closest MTR entrance. It doesn't have a giant lobby or a hotel front which you don't need anyway. Note there is no swimming pool which is something you may like to have for a vacation. However because it the 15-19th floor rooms on a top of a hill you actually get a view of the harbor and the sea, which usually cost an arm or a leg in HK! The only down side is 35 degree uphill leading into the hotel. Its not for disabled or heavy luggage. Also the walls a bit thing so its easy to hear noise from the hallway. In the area I've tried, the Marco Polo Prince, The Mira, and the Butterfly on Prat. The Prince is your standard 4 star hotel roomy and great location in the middle of the shopping mall, but it doesn't have free internet and cost twice ($200-$300) as Butterfly. The Mira is trendy and most W like, but when you take a step back, its an older 3 star hotel layout with a giant face lift decorated into a 5 star boutique and cost like a 5 star. The Bauhinia and Butterfly are both great values. The Bauhinia is a bit farther away but I find it to be a even better value than Butterfly on Prat in terms of the quality of the room and price! Its the cheapest Hotel I've stayed in HK outside of the scary Chungking hostels but turned out to be one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “value . location . comfort .”
Reviews.Author: Penny G
Reviews.Content: we arrived at this hotel on our visit to hong kong in august 2011 . as accommodation in hk isnt cheap , the beauhinia was just a gem . other reviewers have been right about the step hill but its really not that bad , we always just let the taxi overcome that hurdle . the walk to TST station was about 10-15 minutes away which proved to be challenging during the hottttt summer weather , but there were heaps to see on the way and we would just seek refuge in the air-conditioned shops along the way . the hotel was small but it was big enough to cater for our suitcases and alllllll the shopping we did . there is soo much to see and do in hk that we were too delusional and exhausted to care about room size , it was just always so nice to come back to your own small confined space with everything being tidied for you during room service. it was very clean , which i think is the most important aspect about a hotel . hotel staff were reserved but still friendly . it is no luxury or five star hotel but for the price vs. standards , i cant help but give the Bauhinia five stars :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms- big hill”
Reviews.Author: SueT4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a really big hill, view is nice, price not bad. Clean rooms and central to everything

Reviews.Title: “King of the Hill”
Reviews.Author: Rusty_Rimfire
Reviews.Content: My parnter and I arrived at the bottom of a short but daunting hill from the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station. After we conquored the hill we spotted the bright purple facade and headed up to reception where the frendily staff informed us we had been upgraded to a deluxe room which was an unexpected perk. The room was designed to utalise space in a way i had never seen before, the shower was placed almost in the centre of the room with an external curtain for privacy and the way it opened up the room was great it made the whole area seem larger. All the good things were included here such as free wifi and cable tv. The hotel also had a small vending machine and free computers with internet for guests as well as offering printing via the front desk ($5HKD per sheet). A business/meeting room was also on the reception level it looked nice from the outside. The location was great as it was not far from the MTR station or shops but in particular a small row of restuarants and bars just over the road was great lots of variety and quality food available. Our favorite was the ben and jerry's ice cream stand. It is a great hotel for what it is, reasonably priced, small but uses it well. It lacked some features like room service or a restaurant but made up for all this through locaton. Also the mini fridge in the room was empty which actually proved quite practical for us. My partner and i enjoyed our stay and would reccomend the hotel to couples and solo travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay minus the hill :p”
Reviews.Author: AgnesCPM
Reviews.Content: We have 2nights stay over here. Room is well maintained but of course the thing expected was the size of the room was small but that was fine for us. We can view the harbour from our window too eventho bit far but you still can view the ship and sea . Bathroom clean as well but it's quite huge to our expectation (half of the room is taken by the bathroom lol). Staff was friendly too. Lobby at 9th floor. Nearby you don't need to worry about pubs because there were about 4-5 Irish pubs just outside the hotel :) Lotsa of foods and shopping places around there. However note that the distance from TST MTR to this hotel actually not to say near - around 20mins. The only downside was the HILL!! It's really 45degree steep and imagine we are carrying big luggages and climb all the way up. phewww...sweat but if you take cab, this should not be a prob for you. Also if you have more than 2 persons, advise you to take the cab. Save time, energy and money too!! It tooks about HK$ 230 per cab from airport to TST. If you plan to take the Kowloon Airport Express from airport to Kowloon MTR and then to the hotel, there was actually free shuttle bus at Kowloon station to quite a number of major hotels. You can take this shuttle bus and stop at Luxe Manor hotel. From there, you don't need to walk so far and distance only took less than 10mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, initially difficult to find!”
Reviews.Author: sksieski
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 2 nights in the Bauhinia, it was the cheapest of the hotel I found in HK, but unfortunately du to a number of things going on - not that cheap for someone travelling on their own! I took the train to Kowloon station from the airport and then a taxi - Train cost $hk90, and taxi was about $hk50. Observatory court is off Observatory road which is off Kimberly road. My Taxi driver didn't know where it was, but did find it. I was upgraded to a harbour view room on arrival which was lovely.The room was small, with the shower room being in the room, I quite liked it and being on my own was great, but if tere were 2 of you could be a bit cramped for more than a couple of nights. Complimentary Wifi in the room helped. Many of to places to eat in the immediate area are chinese and good value, I ate a couple of times on Kimberly road in a 'cafe; no one spoke english, but picture food is a good send and it was good. Walk to the Main MTR station was about 10 mins Max entrance by teh HSBC bank on Nathan road. MTR is a touch screen and is a great way to get around teh city. Took the metro to the central district where the IFC shopping mall is and to my mind a lot more westernised! That cost about $hk9, whilst the Star Ferry about a 20 minute walk is $hk2. if you are staying there for a while invest in an Octopys card. a Great Restaurant to eat in, in the central district is Wagyu in Wyndham street - Do book, it is rammed especially on a weekend. Food it great and reasonable prices, wine very expensive! Went up to the peak by tram, paid for a return, but actually came back by the number 14 bus which cost $hk 10, well worth it as it winds down the peak, you get a great perspective of the city. Also if you are gong to do the Buddha on Lantau, take the MTR to central change and get the Orange line straight to the cable car. $hk16.50 from TST, takes about 30 mins and is teh quickest wayto get there. Cable car return is about $hk145. well worth it - get great views of teh new airport and obviously the surrounding countryside. The Buddha is absolutely amazing, but the 26o odd steps to teh stop do take it out of yu if you are not fit. Also if it is a hot day take a hat or brolly as the locals do! Final tip, on leaveing you can pick up the K4 on the corner of Kimberly and Observatory, this is free to Kowloon station, and you can then check in at the station and let your bags go off to teh airport, whilst you travel without the agro. no queues, it was great. Even greater to see my bag arrivce at destination :-) (initially was a bit worried). Great service and something I think the UK Lacks! Aother Final tip, there is a local supermarket on Kimberly, where I bought water, $hk5, for 2 litre of water, well worth the purchase. Was only there 1 half days/2 nights so did not get a chance to do Mong kok or the night market or all the other things that there are to do, however I have no hesitation of recommending teh Bauhinia, once you get your bearings it is easy to get around and teh reception staff were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Gave our rooms away - Untrustworthy”
Reviews.Author: powerrose
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for 4 people through Agoda at this hotel. We prepaid in full for the rooms several weeks in advance. We booked two superior rooms with double beds for two nights. Upon arriving, the woman manning the desk (Kaman) told us that she would be upgrading us to deluxe rooms with special bathrooms. It turns out they were incredibly depressing handicapped rooms with a combination shower/toilet (so after showering the entire floor is wet if you want to use the toilet). In no way were these rooms an improvement over our original rooms and were very much a step down. It turned out that the hotel had given away our prepaid rooms "in the morning" because it was very busy. They refused us any other option except a room with two single beds (still a huge improvement over the handicapped rooms). My opinion about this hotel is that they could care less about customers and won't think twice about selling your reserved room to make a few bucks. They knew we would have trouble finding other accommodations on short notice and screwed us, because they could. They were even so dishonest that they labeled their very low quality handicapped rooms as "deluxe" and think their customers are stupid enough to fall for it. They had every opportunity to offer ANYTHING to compensate us or make us happy and they didn't. Even when we switched to the room with 2 single beds, the rooms were not great quality. The rooms are older, there are big holes in the bathroom walls, and the beds are uncomfortable (hard) with cheap sheets. The front desk staff was not helpful and there are very few amenities offered. The photos do not match the reality! I honestly had a much better stay at the Pop Hotel in Mongkok which is half the price. For me, its never worth staying at a hotel that has a policy of dishonesty.

Reviews.Title: “New gem in my necklace boutique hotels”
Reviews.Author: pandastravelers
Reviews.Content: The hotel The Bauhinia Hotel - Tsim Sha Tsui (namely Tsim Sha Tsui, because of this hotel chain, there are other hotels (probably not less than good)) – it’s important when booking!) have great location (from the airport, among other things, can be reached bus A21 for 33HKD per person, for the tourist, choose a hotel in a strange country - twice as nice;). In addition to this undeniable advantages - all the restaurants and boutiques exactly next to the hotel to the waterfront with Aleey of Stars - 5 minutes along the Nathan Road, the main artery Kowllon Island. And most importantly (for me)) - a style of the hotel (there are numbers, what numbers!)) And a wonderful staff! The next time we’ll stop in Hong Kong is in The Bauhinia Hotel - Tsim Sha Tsui;) We will definitely return, but do not raise prices while!;)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely solution but pay attention to location”
Reviews.Author: kodix
Reviews.Content: We booked in Bauhinia after researching only a few minutes and I missed the fact that the hotel is up on a steep uphill section just of Nathan Road. It is very central and allows most travellers to walk almost all of Kowloon and has quick access to MTR altough the Jordan station is actually closer than Tsim Sha Tsui. The hotel is newly designed and taxi drivers do not know of it necessarily. It is situated in floors 18-25 of the 5-9 Observatory Court. It is almost a serviced apartment without kitchen and you hardly feel that you are booked in a hotel. Internet on cable is provided for free and worked okay, but there is no wi-fi connection. Cleanliness and quality of room is very good for its price and there was some east view on the 21st floor although it is not anything to get excited about. There is not much service to discuss and because it is an overnight stay only I have no idea whether cleaning was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Kwonger
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind walking, the area location is easily within range of local attractions and the MTR. The hill up to the hotel is an annoyance but is short. I'd recommend cutting through the Knutsford Terrace to avoid part of that climb.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel if you dont mind the uphill walk”
Reviews.Author: RestlessInMakati
Reviews.Content: this hotel is atop observatory road, so initially i was taken aback (im a bit lazy). that notwithstanding, the location is pretty good, being just a few blocks away from my favorite TST food joint (Yeung Kee), convenience stores and about a 10 minute walk from the TST MTR Station. the rooms were a little bit small, and walls were a little thin. but i did love the interiors of the rooms. mounted lcd tv on the wall and the ipod dock. i also thought that the hanging lamps mounted on the head board was a nice touch (since i brought a lot of reading material). also, they have 2 pretty big complimentary bottles of water which was a pleasant surprise for me. the downside though is that they dont have a restaurant, so no room service nor breakfast. oh and for some reason, the front desk didnt even offer assistance to bring us up to our room and help with our bags. and they did poorly in explaining the charges and payment details. i cant comment on the service cos i hardly felt any person offering assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, Great Location, Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: AshfromMelbs
Reviews.Content: We thought this place was great. Clean digs, comfy bed, good facilities and great location. The room was small, but it's central TST in Hong Kong, so what do you expect. There was a great view, and the bathroom was particularly large and well fitted out. Would stay there again if I head back. It's also easy to get to from the Airport. Catch the Airport Express train from the Airport to Kowloon, then take the free K4 hotel transfer bus from the train station to the Empire hotel, it's just up the hill from there. Costs about US$15 I think, and it's quicker than a taxi. Also on the way back to the airport you can check in at the train station (bag check-in and all). At least we could with Cathay Pacific. Not sure if that goes for other airlines. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “POOR”
Reviews.Author: lolo087
Reviews.Content: the walls are so thin you could hear the tv from next room without switching on your own, particularly distracting when guests next to you watches telly late at night or early mornings. housekeeping are not trained to keep noises down early morning even if you put a DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door. They talk amongst them outside guests room regardless time of the day and bangs the doors and cupboards when cleaning. When asked for extra toilet roll, they didnt show up at all so ended up getting them from local convenience store. WIFI is useless.. let's say it doesnt work at all. There is a paid PC in the lobby which they charge high prices... tactics!!! Do not book this hotel if you want a good night sleep as you would be disturbed both at night and mornings EVERY DAY!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: LSO_SH
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend with my friends in April. We pick this hotel because its location and good price. Check-in was very smooth and fast. Room is small for a twin bed but well equiped, the complimentary internet access is a big plus. Location is good, although it's close to Knutsford Terrace and easy access to TST shopping area, but its steep slope might hurt you if you are carry the luggage from the free shuttle bus stop. View from the room was great, but the sound-proof was poor. First night I can hear next room guest switched TV channels clearly and the loud noise from housekeeping cleaning next morning. Overall the hotel still recommend but be aware the noise during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good value, attentive service”
Reviews.Author: freewheel5
Reviews.Content: Of our 3 days in Hong Kong, 2 were spent entirely in our room at the Bauhinia, recovering from some awful food poisoning acquired our last night in India. But if you're going to have to stay inside, the Bauhinia is a pretty great haven! Well planned room (if small for 2), very comfortable bed, giant picture window with nice 17th-floor view of city (and good light-blocking curtains), fridge, hot water for tea, nice bathroom (where we spent a lot of time, sadly). In room tech was good -- TV and iPod deck. Would have preferred in-room wifi, but at least we could pop up to the 19th floor lobby and use their business center when we needed it. There was a short, steep hill to walk down to Kimberley Road to grab Pedialyte, bananas and ramen, but after the first time it became nothing to worry about. Staff was attentive and sympathetic. We got to see HK on our last day, but if we decide to come back we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel in a great location! Walk to everything!”
Reviews.Author: dnswallow
Reviews.Content: I'd luckily stumbled on this hotel after the original hotel I'd planned had skyrocketed in price as we'd had to postpone our trip. Turns out, we were thrilled with this hotel. Some of the TripAdvisor reviews had mentioned the dreaded hill that this hotel is located on, (and me being very unfit was not looking forward to) but the hill was no problem - it's very short and has stairs. This hotel was great. We managed to get upgraded and the room ended up being quite large and very modern and funky - loved the shower! It was a pleasure to stay here for our holiday. Our room came with all the little luxuries (in terms of soaps, shampoos etc) plus FREE internet which was a godsend. I'd bought a cute little Panda toy which I sat on the bed each morning when I made it (I always make the bed somewhat regardless of room service) and there happened to be a cap sitting on the other side.....one night we'd returned back to the room and I'd found the little Panda sitting on my bed wearing the cap on his head (which clearly room service had done).....it was sooooo cute! I loved that they'd done that! A word of advice - being such a new hotel, many taxi drivers are not aware of it's location, but as the Stanford Hillview hotel is just opposite, it's easier to direct the taxi driver to it instead as they are well aware of it's location. We were aware that the hotel has no restaurant as we were up early each day and back to the hotel late at night, this was never a problem as we ate when we were out. And besides, not having a restaurant means cheaper accommodation rates! Aside from the funky modern rooms, the other great thing about this hotel is the location!! Walk to the Science Centre, Museum, Tsim Sha Shui Ferry Terminal and esplanade overlooking the harbour, MTR, Kowloon park, the list goes on!! But all up, this hotel was a nice modern comfortable (in fact the beds were so comfy I slept like a baby) place to stay and the location was just amazing. I'd taken a few bland Thank You cards on our holiday and I wrote a lovely Thank You note which I left with them. We will definitely stay here on our next visit to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: music111
Reviews.Content: this hotel has excellent clean rooms, specially the twin rooms are best for single travellers, little small in size bt nice an cozy, great view from higher floors, loo's are also clean and also serviced on time, the suite rooms are also very good, this room is spacious, i was shifted in the middle of night to a suite room as the room next door was too noisy :-( which was disturbing, locaton wise also not bad, inside in one of the lanes of tsim sha tsui, but this hotel not recommended to old ppl who hav walking problem, as its on a slop, staff is ok nt that friendlier they made me wait for 4- 5 hours but did not provide me early check in inspite of the rooms being empty, one more draw back, just no resturant, no food at all so just incase u feel like eating sumthin u need to get down the slop go to near by resturant eat an come back an climb the slop, an yes u hav to pik up ur own luggage too, overall good rooms only and also value for money

Reviews.Title: “New and tastefully done”
Reviews.Author: asakthivel
Reviews.Content: excellent interiors, loved the decor. Excellent for young couples. We were on the second honeymoon and really enjoyed the stay there. Only problem is to locate the hotel the first time. They should add "off Kimberly Road" to their address.

Reviews.Title: “For shopping weekends”
Reviews.Author: Muruli
Reviews.Content: The Bauhinia hotel seems to be recently renovated, so new and clean everything still looked. The hotel is a bit off the Nathan Road but the distance is still ok to walk, even with the big shopping bags as we had. Knutsford Terrace with its restaurants and bars is right around the corner which we enjoyed a lot. The closest subway is already a bit further away so if you have big luggage, look for the free hotel shuttle bus to Kowloon station, the closest stop is right at the corner of Kimberley road. The only downfall with the hotel was the size of the room. There was barely any free floor and if we had had bigger bags than just cabin bags, we would have had serious problems with opening the bags.

Reviews.Title: “New & clean”
Reviews.Author: Debuddy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is relatively inexpensive but clean & new. The bed is comfortable with clean sheets. There's a ref, lcd tv, safe, kettle & wired internet in the room. Toiletries& clean towels are provided. Free wifi and computers are available in the lobby(located in the 19th floor). The hotel is a 10-minute walk from TST MTR & near shopping mall. Airport express shuttle stop is just at the base of the hill from the hotel. Downside, the room is really small compared to the other hotels we've stayed before in Hongkong. We keep on moving our luggage every time we open the ref or the cabinets. We had a hard time figuring out how to control the aircon. We set it at 24C, it keeps going back to 20.5C. No pool, gym or restos inside the hotel but the hotel is surrounded with bars & restos. There 's a steep hill before you can reach the hotel, which is a bit of a struggle after a day of walking. I would recommend this hotel if you're not after the amenities & would be out most of the day. Since this is relatively new, the taxi driver doesn't know where it is. Good thing we had the address & phone number, the driver was able to contact the hotel for directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Clean modern small rooms a short walk from the action.”
Reviews.Author: stephanieahensley
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. When I booked it, it was very inexpensive for a Hong Kong hotel, and I was nervous about the cleanliness after some experiences with cheap HK hotels in the past. This hotel was great! The rooms are small, but very clean with an Ipod dock/alarm clock. The bathroom was very large for the room size, and internet was included, a huge plus! Yes, the hill is very steep, so if you have leg problems, this may not be the best hotel for you. But as a woman who wears high heels quite a bit, the sidewalk was graded and had stairs to make the walk to and from the hotel a bit easier.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden and walking up the steep streets to get to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: xoxoCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Room is small but I guess that is normal for Hong Kong. Great view. We paid for a double queen or a double twin, but I guess to them "double" mean two people sleeping together in one bed. My mother and I were given a room with one queen size bed. After complaining, we were given a room with double twin. The double twin is two twin size mattresses but together. I prepaid for shuttle service from the airport to this hotel. The shuttle company didn't even know where this hotel was located. When they figured where it was located, they said that they were not authorized to drop us at the hotel so they had to drop us off at a hotel near by. We had to drag our own luggages up the steep hills to this hotel. It was a major work out and my mother was close to getting a heart attack. When we made it to entrace of the building, no one at the counter on the 1st floor bothered to help us. The check in lobby is at the 9th floor.... The most annoying thing about this hotel is the elevator and no one helping us with our luggages. I would love to tip someone, if there was anyone to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Low Cost Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christi409
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here mid December 2010. We settled on this hotel largely because it was one of the least expensive hotels we could find with good reviews. I was very impressed with how nice this little hotel turned out to be. The room was immaculate and came complete with slippers, shampoo, conditioner, soap, body wash, body lotion, a shaver, 2 toothbrushes, and a comb. I was impressed with the number of products included since usually when I stay in a comparable hotel, I'm lucky to get a shampoo/conditioner combo. I was also pleasantly surprised to find the LCD TV and ipod dock in the room. Free wired internet is available in the room as well as free wifi in the lounge (and computers if you didn't bring yours). This hotel does not have meal service, but there is plenty in the area, including bars across the street. I did not once wish that they served food. Honestly, the only bad thing I can say is that our second day there, housekeeping forgot to leave a roll of toilet tissue, but it was quickly fixed. The room was cleaned amazingly each day and all of the shampoos etc replaced, including the toothbrushes despite those being easily reusable! Hong Kong rooms are notoriously small, even in the 5-star hotels, but I found there to be plenty of space. My friend and I had 1 fairly large suitcase to share, and we found that there were places out of the way to tuck it. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are not fussy about having food/gym/pool available. And let's be honest, how much time are you going to spend at the pool when you're in Hong Kong?

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT FIND”
Reviews.Author: SPAMELOPE
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending the Bauhinia Hotel in Hong Kong. Thsi is a new hotel and offers excellent value for money in an very expensive city. The rooms are comfortable, clean and the view from the higher floors is stunning. The hotel does not offer any meal service, but this is not a problem because of the multitide of eateries in the area. The hotel is situated just of Nathan Road, within about 15 minutes walk from the MRT station and offers easy accss to all of Hong Kong's attractions and shopping malls. The only problem is the short, but steep uphill walk to reach the property. I would return there should I visit Hong Kong again.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities”
Reviews.Author: GollyDize
Reviews.Content: The hotel facilities was good, the location convenient. Our room was not so large but comfy and clean. The wifi was free in the room, worked very well - a plus. Staff was friendly and helpful. Will come back next time and would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Free Internet & Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: Ti_Chan
Reviews.Content: Booked via booking.com with rate around 95 USD/night in early Dec 2010. Stayed for 6 nights in room 203. Like: • Room is newly renovated, modern design. Good aircon, empty fridge to cool your drinks, LCD TV. Have safety box. Room cleaning is immaculate • Location: 10 mins walk to TST MTR. Near enough to the bustling Nathan road, but far enough not to hear all of the noises. • Free internet in room (but with LAN cable, not Wifi) • Got free upgrade to harbor view room • Supermarket at the corner; good to stock food supplies • Helpful staff. My husband actually lost his passport when we were in Hong Kong and the staff help to let us know when the police call (although at that time we already checked out) Dislike: • Taxi cannot find the hotel although I have printed maps. Good thing that I remember in one of the review mentioning that the hotel is in a very steep hill (there’s only 1 steep corner there) • Room is very small – unlike the pictures on the website. I’m used to stay in small places; but I guess it was the difference vs pictures that let me down. Hardly any place to put your suitcase down. • Giant dumpster in front of the hotel. I don’t know why they keep it there (not smelly though) Overall I would say this is a value for money place to stay. Hotels that are 2-3 times more expensive just around the corner. I would stay here again without any hesitation. If you’re not too fussy yourself, I think you’ll enjoy your stay here.
